description:
Our next meetup will be in September. It's another virtual meetup. Join us on zoom at 7pm. You'll get the link when you RSVP.

We're delighted to have *two fantastic speakers* join us this month: Dan Moore from FusionAuth, and prolific open source contributor and maintainer Maciej Mensfeld.

== Maciej Mensfeld ==

** OSS Supply Chain Security for Ruby **

Maciej is a software architect and engineer working with http://castle.io. He has experience with a wide variety of business applications built using multiple Ruby frameworks.

He's particularly interested in code quality and Ruby-based applications security.

He's an active OSS contributor and maintainer of various projects including Karafka, dry-rb libraries and Bundler-Security project.

It's wonderful Maciej can share some of his experience, wisdom and knowledge with us this month, and there's a good chance you've used code Maciej has written, so it's also a chance to say thank you :).

== Dan Moore ==

** JWTs: what Rails developers need to know **

Dan Moore is a developer advocate for FusionAuth. He's been using Ruby and Rails off and on since 2015. A former CTO, engineering manager and longtime developer, he's been writing software for (checks watch) over 20 years.

What is a JSON Web Token (JWT) and why do you care? JWTs are a stateless, standardized way to represent user data. This talk will discuss why JWTs matter and the nuts and bolts of JWTs. We'll also briefly discuss how you might use a JWT in your Rails application.

* * *

** (Approximate) Schedule **

7.00pm - Welcome

7.05pm - Maciej Mensfeld, OSS Supply Chain Security for Ruby

7.50pm - Dan Moore, JWTs: what Rails developers need to know

* * *

Look forward to seeing you soon!
title: South West Ruby #29 (ONLINE)
